articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Eden Games will develop NFT-powered games in Animoca’s REVV Racing ecosystem, following last month’s shuttering of F1 Delta Time.
articles.title: Animoca Acquires Eden Games to Make Crypto Racing Games After F1 Shutdown

articles.author: Jeff Benson
articles.description: Musk recently became Twitter's largest shareholder. He has some ideas for how to improve the social media platform.
articles.title: Elon Musk Wants Twitter Blue Subscriptions to Be Paid in Dogecoin—Is He Joking?

articles.description: The three-part series will feature Bored Ape characters submitted by community members, and tie into Coinbase’s NFT marketplace.
articles.title: Coinbase to Produce Bored Ape Yacht Club Animated Short Films

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Sony and LEGO’s parent company are backing the Fortnite maker's metaverse plans, but it’s not clear whether Epic Games will build on blockchain networks.
articles.title: Epic Games Raises $2B to 'Build the Metaverse'—Will It Use Crypto or NFTs?

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Bored & Hungry began slinging burgers and fries on Saturday, with the restaurant accepting Ethereum and ApeCoin as payment.
articles.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club-Themed Burger Joint Debuts in California

articles.description: Although a majority of financial advisers would invest more in crypto if a spot ETF product were available, they don't expect one this year.
articles.title: 72% of Financial Advisors Would Invest More in Crypto If Spot ETF Were Available: Nasdaq Survey

articles.description: ARK Invest CEO Cathie Wood called PayPal’s Venmo a “follower” of Block’s Cash App payment system, which uses Bitcoin’s Lightning Network.
articles.title: Cathie Wood: ARK Invest 'Chose Block Over PayPal' Due To Cash App's Bitcoin Focus

articles.description: By pegging to an inflation index rather than a fiat currency, Volt aims to help DeFi users maintain their purchasing power.

articles.description: Bitcoin and Ethereum, the industry’s two largest cryptocurrencies, are both down to almost three-week lows.
articles.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Slip to Three-Week Lows

articles.description: The billionaire co-founder of The Carlyle Group, David Rubenstein, has reversed his previously "skeptical" view of cryptocurrencies.

articles.description: Twitter’s CEO Parag Agrawal has announced that Elon Musk will no longer be joining the Board for the social media giant.

articles.description: Gemini's COO also shared his views on NFTs and stablecoins in a wide-ranging interview at Bitcoin 2022 in Miami.
articles.title: Gemini’s Noah Perlman on Why He’s Not Spending His Bitcoin and Compliance as ‘Competitive Advantage’

articles.description: Two rich guys spent a lot of money, while another rich guy appears to be hoping the promise of NFTs will end growing calls for unionization.
articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Elon Musk Joins Twitter IRL, Do Kwon Buys More Bitcoin

articles.description: Our Web3 insider columnist shares her keys to success for business development, an under-examined corner of the crypto industry.
articles.title: 3 Keys to Success in Crypto Biz Dev

articles.description: The Terra community's new "4pool" proposal adds more fuel to the fiery competition between its UST stablecoin and MakerDAO's DAI.

articles.title: Gemini COO Talks to Decrypt at Bitcoin Miami 2022

articles.description: Robinhood Crypto CTO Johann Kerbrat talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Bitcoin Miami 2022 about Robinhood's new Lightning Network integration, potential NFT plans, and Kerbrat's personal history with crypto, including mining Bitcoin back in 2010.
articles.title: Robinhood Crypto CTO Talks to Decrypt at Bitcoin Miami 2022

articles.description: The holder, who jilted auction house Sotheby’s in February, secured a sizable DAI loan on a bundle of 104 CryptoPunks NFTs.
articles.title: Ethereum NFT-Backed Loan Market Heats Up as CryptoPunks Owner Borrows $8.3M

articles.description: Crypto is becoming mainstream in Washington, D.C.—so why are politicians still shy about showing their crypto stripes?
articles.title: Why Politicians Still Can't Lead With Crypto

articles.description: It looks like stablecoin regulation soon may be coming to both the U.S. and the U.K.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: Market Leaders Dip as Regulations Inch Closer to Becoming Reality

articles.description: Without liquidity, financial systems grind to a halt. In decentralized finance (DeFi), liquidity pools help keep things running smoothly.
articles.title: What Are Liquidity Pools? The Funds That Keep DeFi Running

articles.description: Make your accountant (or TurboTax) proud: Don't fall for these.
articles.title: 7 Common Crypto Tax Myths and How to Avoid Them

articles.description: As with the recent ApeCoin scam, the perpetrators are stealing users’ accounts and blasting out a similar NFT token scam.
articles.title: Twitter Scammers Are Hijacking Verified Accounts for Fake Azuki NFT Airdrop

articles.description: CME will offer reference rates for 11 altcoins—an important prerequisite for crypto ETFs and derivatives.
articles.title: CME Adds Reference Rates for Solana, Cardano, Polygon and Other Altcoins

articles.description: Robinhood shares slipped 5% in intraday trading, while Coinbase was down nearly 2.5%.
articles.title: Coinbase and Robinhood Shares Slide After Goldman Predicts Low Q1 Earnings

articles.description: The rapper and actor talks to Decrypt about his plans for music NFTs and how the tech can disrupt the entertainment industry.
articles.title: Ice Cube: NFTs Are the 'Ultimate Fuck You' to Media Gatekeepers

articles.description: Blockstream says the facility, which will generate 3.8 megawatts of power, will be completed by the end of 2022.
articles.title: Tesla, Blockstream and Block Break Ground on All-Solar Bitcoin Mining Facility in Texas

articles.description: The native token behind Near Protocol has enjoyed a heady 24 hours following news that the project had landed another round of new funding.
articles.title: Near Protocol Jumps 23% Amid Fresh $350M Funding

articles.description: The European Union has expanded its existing sanctions against Russia to include “high-value crypto-asset services.”
articles.title: EU Bans High Value Crypto Services to Russia Aimed at Closing Sanctions Loopholes

articles.description: The U.S. Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation is concerned about the crypto-related risks facing the various banks it supervises.
articles.title: FDIC Sounds Alarm on Crypto in Letter to Banks

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: The SEC has approved another Bitcoin futures ETF to start trading. Here's why that might be good news for a Bitcoin spot ETF.

articles.description: Peter Thiel threw cash into the crowd—and insults toward the finance and tech industry—at the Bitcoin 2022 conference in Miami.
articles.title: Peter Thiel Unleashes on Ethereum, Warren Buffett and His ‘Enemies' at Bitcoin 2022

articles.description: Mexico’s third-richest man has upped his holdings over the years, he says.
articles.title: Mexican Billionaire Ricardo Salinas Says His Liquid Portfolio Is 60% Bitcoin

articles.description: Improbable’s new entity seeks to bring large-scale Web3 metaverse worlds to life—and is valued at $1B thanks to Andreessen and others.
articles.title: Gaming Startup Improbable Raises $150M to Connect Metaverse Worlds

articles.description: Online payment provider Bolt bought crypto services Wyre with the goal of providing "one-click" crypto payments.
articles.title: Bolt Pays $1.5B for Crypto Startup Wyre in Biggest Crypto Acquisition to Date

articles.author: Jeff Benson
articles.description: Terra-linked Luna Foundation Guard has been boosting the price of Bitcoin. Now it's buying Avalanche (AVAX), too.
articles.title: Luna Foundation Guard to Buy $100 Million in Avalanche to Backstop Terra

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: The financial trading app is taking the next step into cryptocurrency investing through the Bitcoin Lightning Network.
articles.title: Robinhood to Use Lightning Network for Bitcoin Transactions

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen remains dubious of stablecoins and says Treasury is still studying centrally-backed digital currency.
articles.title: Treasury's Janet Yellen: 'No One Can Assure You' Stablecoins Can Be Redeemed

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: The Zigazoo kids’ social media app is launching NFTs, including those from CoComelon, Blippi, and young artist Nyla Hayes.
articles.title: Here Come NFTs for Kids: YouTube Smash CoComelon Heading to Flow Blockchain

articles.author: Jeff John Roberts
articles.description: Block announced a trio of Bitcoin-related features for Cash App, including the ability to receive Lightning payments.
articles.title: Cash App Now Offers 'Paid in Bitcoin' Feature, 'Lightning Receive' Coming Soon

articles.author: Scott Chipolina
articles.description: The Ultimate Fighting Championship will soon pay fighters’ bonuses in Bitcoin thanks to a partnership with Crypto.com
articles.title: UFC Fighters Can Now Receive Bonuses in Bitcoin

articles.description: The legendary rapper, actor, and entrepreneur Ice Cube talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward about why his BIG3 basketball league plans to offer fractional team ownership in the form of NFTs, plus his personal interest in crypto.
articles.title: Ice Cube: Crypto and NFTs Are ‘The Ultimate Fuck You to the Mainstream’

articles.description: Tax Day is coming, and the crypto world is paying attention. Decrypt's Jeff Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Adriana Hamacher discuss what people and businesses need to know about crypto and taxes with special guest Nicholas Mowbray of Baker Hostetler.
articles.title: #DecryptLIVE: Crypto, Taxes, and You

articles.description: Caitlin Long spent nearly two decades at big banks Credit Suisse and Morgan Stanley before she went all in on Bitcoin. Now her company Custodia is seeking to offer banking services to crypto companies long shut out by the big banks. She talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about identifying as a Bitcoin maximalist, crypto regulation in DC, and Web3 culture.
articles.title: gm Podcast, Episode 6: Ditching Big Banks for Bitcoin With Caitlin Long

articles.description: Politicians are embracing crypto on both sides of the aisle. Matt West, running for congress in Oregon, Matthew Diemer, running for congress in Ohio, and former Wyoming Rep. Tyler Lindholm discussed crypto and politics on a panel with Decrypt's Jeff Roberts at Camp Ethereal in Wyoming. As Diemer pointed out, "We have a conservative Republican, a progressive Democrat, and a moderate Democrat on the same stage, unified by crypto and the idea of making sensible regulation."
articles.title: Crypto on the Campaign Trail: Matt West, Matthew Diemer, Tyler Lindholm at Camp Ethereal 2022

articles.description: Tax season is upon us, and crypto investors have questions. Tony Dhanjal, Head of Tax at crypto tax software service Koinly, shares tips in this sponsored segment.
articles.title: Crypto Taxes Got You Down? Software Can Help

articles.description: Anthony Georgiades, co-founder of Pastel Network, talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at Camp Ethereal 2022 about NFT security and the importance of protecting your digital artwork.
articles.title: Pastel Network's Georgiades: How to Protect Your NFTs

articles.description: Andrew Yang, the former presidential and NYC mayoral candidate, talked crypto regulation in DC on Decrypt's gm podcast with Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts. Yang says the days of little or no crypto regulation in DC are "very very quickly coming to end" and that the question now is what the new rules will look like.
articles.title: Andrew Yang on Crypto Regulation in DC: 'This Train Is Coming. What's the Cargo?'

articles.description: Gitcoin co-founder Scott Moore tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson all about Gitcoin's GR13 grant, which is raising money for Ukraine and has matching participation from a range of Web3 names like OpenSea, OlympusDAO, NounsDAO, Polygon, Algorand, and more.
articles.title: Gitcoin's Scott Moore Talks Ukraine Fundraising Grant

articles.description: Robert Drost, Head of R&D at ConsenSys, talks Layer 2s and building atop Ethereum with James Prestwich of Nomad and Sreeram Kannan of LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming.
articles.title: The Importance of Layer 2: ConsenSys, Nomad, and LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal

articles.description: Jordan Garbis, co-founder of BeetsDAO, and Kent Barton, who does tokenomics at ShapeShift DAO, talk to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming about how to start a DAO, the hurdles with growing them, how to handle tokenomics and reward structure, and how to approach bad behavior by DAO members. At the end, they also took questions from the audience.
articles.title: ShapeShift, BeetsDAO Talk DAO Creation and Governance at Camp Ethereal

articles.description: The former presidential candidate and NYC mayoral candidate has launched Lobby3, a DC lobbying DAO. He talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about his crypto journey, the potential of DAOs, and the need to blend a Web3 approach with "the old-fashioned way" to spur change in DC.
articles.title: gm Podcast, Episode 5: Andrew Yang Wants You to Join His DAO

articles.description: Edward Snowden gives an extensive interview to Marta Belcher of Filecoin Foundation for Camp Ethereal 2022, taped on February 27. He talks about how governments view crypto as "an evolving threat," how crypto "transforms power relationships," why he thinks Ethereum "suffers from the same privacy problems as Bitcoin," and why he views central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) as "crypto-fascist currencies."
articles.title: Edward Snowden Talks Governments and Crypto, CBDCs, and Ethereum vs Bitcoin at Camp Ethereal

articles.description: Musician and DJ Dillon Francis and Big Night Entertainment managing partner Tim Bonito tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about their deal for a Boston nightclub residency and record collaboration with DJ duo ESCAPΞPLAN, and give their takes on Ethereum vs Solana for buying and trading NFTs.
articles.title: Musician Dillon Francis on Ethereum vs Solana for NFTs

articles.description: Musician and DJ Dillon Francis tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin what drew him to NFTs, and heaps a lot of praise on DJ 3LAU for pioneering in the space and prompting more artists to get in.
articles.title: Musician Dillon Francis: Why I'm Getting Into NFTs
